At that time, King of the Heaven of YÄma SuyÄma and the heavenly multitudes, the multitudes of heavenly maidens, innumerable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of thousands of heavenly multitudes, and the multitudes of heavenly maidens, all went to the place of the mountain and trees, to the mountain of Gana.
All the heavenly multitudes sat on lotus flower seats, pervading the sky, and went up to the mountain.
Seeing the heavenly multitudes with innumerable kinds of forms and adornments, with innumerable kinds of colors and innumerable kinds of merits, surrounded by heavenly maidens.
The gods on that mountain, with the five desires and merits, experienced all kinds of pleasures.

At that time, King of the Heaven of YÄma SuyÄma, having seen this, was overjoyed. Together with the multitudes of heavenly maidens, he quickly went to the place of the mountain and trees, to the heavenly multitudes.

The heavenly beings there, upon seeing King Muá¹£itasmrti, quickly went to welcome him together with the celestial maidens, with the sounds of drums and music, various songs and dances, their minds filled with joy, mutually approaching each other, and uniting with each other.
Everywhere on the mountain peak, with various songs and dances, they praised King Muá¹£itasmrti and went to the mountain together with him.
On that mountain, they mutually enjoyed themselves with various sounds and attained pleasure.
Those heavenly beings thus enjoyed pleasures for a very long time.
In the sky above, they saw a shooting star falling.
The light and other phenomena of that shooting star were as described before.

At that time, the heavenly beings, having seen such extraordinary events, again gave rise to a doubtful and apprehensive mind, with great fear, and immediately went to be near King Muá¹£itasmrti of the YÄma Heaven, relying on him.
Some looked straight up into the sky and gazed at it;
Those who had heard of the celestial dog before, leaving behind indulgent behavior, sincerely paid homage to the Buddha together with the celestial king Musulunda.
There were also those who were terrified and entered the golden cave, and those who relied on the trees, these two kinds of gods had no courage or strength.
There were gods who ran to the YÄma Heaven King Musulunda seeking refuge and rescue.
They saw this as the most extraordinary thing, and their minds were filled with doubt.
At that time, the celestial king Musulunda, having seen this, told the celestial assembly:
'You celestial beings, do you know or not know that this light in the sky is about to fall to the ground?
All of you come here.'
Among them, there were gods who did not know before, and they said to the celestial king Musulunda:
'We truly do not know.
Now seeing this extraordinary event, we truly do not know.'
At that time, King of the Heaven of the Thirty-three will call all the gods and tell them:
'You gods, all listen, I will now explain for you.
Because the light in the sky falls to the ground, you gods who are afraid or have a rare mind,
' At that time, all the gods, the king of the Heaven of the Thirty-three will explain for them:
'You all listen!
Above us, very far away, there are other gods.
In all aspects, their lifespan, karma, and causes are a hundred times better than ours. This is the first supreme purity of the bodhisattvas.

When they were among humans, they upheld the five precepts without holes or flaws, firmly and without transgression, due to having immeasurable superior practices. When their bodies perished and their lives ended, they were reborn in the good destinies, in the heavens.
That heavenly realm is called Tuá¹£ita.

In Tuá¹£ita Heaven, the pleasures they experience, the gardens and forests, the celestial maidens, the lights, the forms, the strength, the sharp wisdom, the long life, the immeasurable happiness, whether of body or mind, the enjoyments and necessities they use, and the beauty of the celestial maidens - all of this is not even one-sixteenth of the pleasures in YÄma Heaven.
The merits of those gods cannot be described by me.
The light of those gods would make the light of YÄma Heaven here appear like a firefly compared to the sun.
All their lights and enjoyments and necessities are not even a fraction of those in Tuá¹£ita Heaven.
For a long time, those gods experience immeasurable kinds of happiness.
The pleasures of those gods are the most delightful, with various objects and the five sense pleasures, they experience happiness surpassing the pleasures of YÄma Heaven here.
After a long time, the good karma is exhausted, and the vajra of impermanence shatters it.
The law of impermanence definitely exists in all sentient beings, and the seeds of impermanence definitely exist in all sentient beings.
The seeds of impermanence definitely exist in all sentient beings.
When impermanence arrives, their lives are exhausted. Because their good karma is exhausted, they then fall from the Tuá¹£ita Heaven.
All conditioned things flow like a lamp, that is, arising, abiding, and ceasing. In the three realms, there is no thing that does not move and is permanent.
All move, all end, and are not permanent dharmas. There is no place that is permanent.
All conditioned dharmas will definitely decline and be lost.
Therefore, that place in the Tuá¹£ita Heaven will definitely decline and be lost. Just as when the oil and wick of a lamp are exhausted, the lamp goes out.ğŸ”½When the lamp goes out, darkness arises.
When the lamp arises, darkness ceases; when the lamp goes out, darkness arises.
Just as when a seed perishes, a sprout arises.
In the same way, when that karma is exhausted, their life is also exhausted.
The gods in that place, the Tuá¹£ita Heaven, are like this because of their decline. You now see that those gods have already died. By the power of karma, there are such signs.

The body is indeterminate. Although dead, there is such radiance. How much more so the radiance created by immeasurable good karma, and the radiance created by the most excellent and supreme good karma.
You night-shining gods should now know that their signs are like this. If they have not yet died, what radiance do they have?ğŸ”½What spiritual powers do they have?
What adornments do they have?
What kind of karma do they have?
They are indescribable and have no analogy.
The gods are like this, created by four times the good karma. In this way, they are exhausted. How much more so for my three times of upholding the precepts, created by little karma?
You have all been born in the Heaven of YÄma, which is fragile and impermanent, compounded and turbid. Therefore, this heaven is utterly different from that.
Even that heaven is still destroyed, how much more so will you not be destroyed?'
At that time, King of the Heaven Muzhoulou Tuo spoke a verse, saying:
The inconstant heavenly dog blinks, burning the Tuá¹£ita Heaven,
Because of lack of autonomy, it perishes, like a lamp with exhausted oil and wick.
Pushed by the power of karma, with great force and twelve spokes,
The wheel of karma turns, not stopping above or below.
Grasping various objects, with immeasurable gates and adornments,
Because of the fulfillment of time, darkness retreats and lacks autonomy.
Because of the autonomy of time, grasses and trees are born like this,
When they reach that time, they wither and dry up again.
When the time comes for the gods, they attain heavenly bliss;
When the time comes again, they fall back and are no longer free.
When the time comes for karma, one transmigrates in the world;
Because time is sovereign, the happy one suffers again.
Whether one experiences happiness or suffering, do not trust that objects are permanent;
All of these causes and conditions, happiness and suffering are then distinguished.
All are without happiness, all are sovereign in karma;
Suffering is also impermanent, all are due to the causes of karma.
Various fruits arise, conditioned phenomena transmigrate;
If one wishes to know this cause and condition, one should know the Four Noble Truths.
If one knows the Four Noble Truths, one will definitely attain liberation;
The deluded who delight in objects, the world turns like a wheel.
One who skillfully knows the meaning and knows the truth will attain liberation;
Those who do not understand the truth of meaning will have no chance for liberation.
If they know in this way that the world is impermanent,
Then they will give rise to the intention for liberation and restrain the mind from unwholesome actions.'
The YÄma Heaven is like this, with immeasurable kinds of immeasurable distinctions.
The YÄma Heaven King MaudgalyÄyana is in accord with the Dharma and speaks in this way.
At that time, the gods, having heard the words of the wise king, each have different thoughts.
Some are disgusted, some are weary of birth and death, some fear birth and death, and some again turn to delight in the objects of the senses.

In the Gana Mountain, there are various gardens and forests, various places for play, many flowing streams and lotus ponds, and other adornments. The branches of the trees cover the sky, and there are treasures to adorn them. There are various kinds of birds with lovely voices, and lotus ponds with various adornments. There are the seven great treasures to adorn the mountain.

There are many kinds of delightful sounds, textures, tastes, forms, and smells, and together with the heavenly maidens they enjoy the pleasures of the objects, loving and delighting in them, forgetting the previous disgust and no longer remembering it.
Moreover, the objects are initially pleasurable but ultimately painful. Together with the heavenly maidens, they experience various pleasures.
Because of the places on the mountain, the monkey-like mind, with its power of freedom, experiences pleasure there.
Moreover, the heavenly multitudes all follow the heavenly lord Muzhoulou together. Some ride through the air, some sit on lotus flowers, and some ride in immeasurable adornments.

Namely, some heavenly beings ride peacocks, some ride white elephants, some ride geese, and some ride mandarin ducks. There are various such different mounts. Heavenly maidens surround them, singing and dancing, with various kinds of music, as befits the gods.
in front of the great king of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, towards the abode of the Heaven of Joy in the Pleasure Grove.
With various profound minds, some are aware of disgust, some are heedless.
Thus, they experience various kinds of happiness in the realm of play.
In the Pleasure Grove, the heavens in different places are distinguished in various ways.
If the heavens dwelling in the place of Complete with Mountains and Trees on the peak of Mount Gana,
with various minds, play and enjoy themselves.
Among them, some heavens give rise to disgust.
Thus, they experience various kinds of happiness with immeasurable distinctions and immeasurable realms.

Thus, they experience immeasurable realms of happiness, their minds never satisfied, until finally the good karmic causes of happiness are exhausted, rotten, lost, and they fall from that heavenly realm when their karma is exhausted.
Having fallen like this, bound by various ropes of karma, they are born in the hells, hungry ghost realms, or animal realms.

If born among humans, they are always in pleasant places, with complete faculties, possessing good wisdom, with the greatest mind, and the greatest wealth. They are always worshipped by all people, with an upright, beautiful appearance. They may become a king or a great minister.
This is due to remaining karma.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the fruits of karma, observes the places in the Heaven of YÄma.
He then hears and knows:
There is another place called Broad Practice.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
He sees and knows:

If a good man approaches good spiritual friends, believes in the fruits of karma, has a sincere mind, follows the practice of the Dharma, upholds the precepts, has right views and is not deviant, practices the right views, always associates with the elderly, gives rise to pure faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, believes in birth and death, always at all times well controls the faculties, is not attached to objects and fears birth and death;
Knows the separation of love, birth, old age, sickness and death, the gathering of loved ones, and the separation of loved ones, all of which he knows;
In the five aggregates, he knows their faults, always diligently practices good deeds, and avoids bad friends;
Always at all times enjoys hearing the right Dharma, after hearing contemplates, after contemplating knows the meaning, embraces it in the mind, and knows the taste of detachment from desire;
Always does not kill, always does not steal, as previously stated.
Furthermore, abandons deviant conduct:
With regard to the female faculties, the eyes do not enjoy seeing;
They do not savor the music and beautiful sounds they hear.
When they see or hear of painted women, they do not have any improper thoughts.
If they dream of women, they do not enjoy it when they wake up, and do not give rise to any affection.
They do not engage in sexual activity too often, always observing correctly, abandoning sexual misconduct, and regarding sexual matters as no different from poison.

Such a person, endowed with these virtues, always practices good deeds, always has good thoughts, has a mind free from defilement, upholds the precepts universally and purely, and well protects the precepts.
When such a person's body perishes and their life ends, they are reborn in a good realm, in the heaven world of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, in the place of Broad Practice.
Having cultivated and practiced these three virtues extensively, delighting in pure precepts, the result of upholding the precepts causes one to be reborn there.
As soon as one is born there, one hears the sounds of heavenly birds, which are extremely delightful, like the sound of the bharata bird.
The nose smells fragrances that have never been experienced before, the fragrances of the first heaven, and upon smelling them, one experiences the utmost bliss.
The body experiences tactile sensations that have never been experienced before, and the mind becomes pure and untroubled.
As the mind turns, in accordance with reality, one gives rise to joy.
Flavors are also like this, with various flavors that have never been experienced before.
In this way, the six sense faculties of the gods experience bliss, and they think:
'What kind of world is this?
Where do I reside?
Everything here is delightful and enjoyable, unlike before.
In this world, one sees all kinds of colors, countless beautiful colors.'

They also see their own bodies emitting light surpassing the radiance of the sun, free from the impurities of flesh and bones, free from all defilements, free from shadows and reflections, free from veins and sinews, free from large and small joints, and free from the sensation of solidity.
The body is soft and supple, with all parts of the body soft and yielding.
Free from fatigue, one's own thoughts and actions, whether coming or going, are all unobstructed.
Free from seeking and grasping, free from bodily hunching and curving.
Each other is not hateful or jealous.
The body's mixed hair and head hair are all curled, with each hair curled, and the eyes gaze without obstruction.
The realm is not inferior, free from the obstructions of sound, touch, taste, and smell.
The body does not increase or decrease, does not change or age, and always has strength.
Jealousy, fear, and timidity of celestial maidens are all gone.
The body is complete, free from seeking adornments, free from seeking wealth, and free from the fault of grasping at celestial maidens.
What else is to be abandoned?
Wandering everywhere in the gardens and forests without fear, free from the fear of enemies, free from the fear of impurity, free from contentment.
Seeing one's own body, one gives rise to delight, and the thought of it grows moment by moment.
The heavens have immeasurable kinds of pleasures of the objects of the senses. One obtains all the pleasures one wishes for.
Having wished for pleasure, due to little wisdom, one's mind has such doubts:
'Where did I come from?
What kind of body is this body of mine?
What place is this?
What is this place called?'
One thinks like this in one's mind, full of doubts.
It is like a drunk person or a sleeping person. In the night, which has four parts, three parts have passed. One awakens from sleep and for a long time, one's mind has thoughts of doubt:
'What kind of person am I?
Where do I live?'
After thinking for a little while, one then knows.
In this way, in this way, the newly born celestial being, after thinking for a long time, only then knows that I died among humans and was reborn in this place.
In the human realm, they cultivated precepts and wholesome thoughts, and in this way they were reborn in the heavens.
If in JambudvÄ«pa one does not delight in objects, when first born in those heavens, one will also not delight in them.
Why is this?
It is because of the original cultivation of wholesome thoughts. At that time, it was like this.
The newly born celestial being will, after a long time, realize and know that he is in the heavens, born in the celestial realms due to wholesome karma.
If a person is like this, having died in the human realm and been reborn in the heavens, because he upheld precepts in the past, he will still not be attached to objects.
In this way, after falling from the heavens later, he will be reborn in the human realm. Because of the original cultivation in the heavens, there will be similarities.
In this way, because of the cultivation of wholesome thoughts in the human realm, after death he will be reborn in the heavens, not delighting in objects and not indulging in desire.
At that time, the newly born god, due to upholding precepts, although born in that heaven, does not approach the sense objects.
Due to other karmic causes, his mind is like this, not delighting in the sense objects.
If one who has been born in the heavens after leaving hell, due to the karma of that birth, it is difficult to leave hell.
Due to other good karma, and due to little aspiration, one can leave hell and be born in the heavens.

Having come from such a place of suffering and distress, being born in the heavens and obtaining happiness, one immediately becomes attached, and the mind gives rise to joy, and one is also very angry.
Delighting in gardens, forests, flowing streams, ponds, various lotus flowers, with a mind of supreme love and joy, one plays and roams about.
Regarding food and drink, one has a strong mind of love and joy, because one's mind is continuously perfumed by that.

If one who has left the realm of hungry ghosts and is born in the heavens due to remaining karma, the mind is continuously perfumed, and one strongly delights in eating. One loves food and drink, always stays in cool places, and greatly enjoys women.
Because they are perfumed by the mind.
If one emerges from the animal realm and is reborn in the heavens due to remaining karma, one will have abundant food and drink.
Just as in the animal realm one eats and drinks much, so it is also in the heavens. One eats and drinks much, or eats little and drinks much, with a strong mind of desire.
This is so because the mind continues to be perfumed.

If one falls from the four realms of the formless realm and is reborn in those heavens - because one originally cultivated and attained samÄdhi, one is therefore reborn in the four realms of the formless realm. Due to the exhaustion of karma, one falls and is reborn in those heavens. Because the original mind continues to be perfumed, one thus desires to experience tactile objects, forms, smells, and so forth. Having obtained them, one is no longer interested.
Because the mind is tranquil and not greatly disturbed, it is perfumed by the mind.
If in the form realm, one relies on the first dhyÄna, and so forth, up to relying on the fourth dhyÄna.

When their meditation is exhausted, they fall back and are reborn in the desire realm. In this way, due to the continuous perfuming of their original intention, there are degrees of superior, middling, and inferior, with a fondness for sitting in meditation.
The mind that delights in objects is small and not abundant.
If the gods in the desire realm fall from the desire realm, they are reborn in the desire realm due to the karma of birth.
In this way, the two paths create various wholesome karma. Whether as gods or humans, these two kinds, having fallen from the desire realm gods, are reborn as desire realm gods.
It is only in the desire realm that they are reborn as desire realm gods due to creating wholesome karma.
All the gods have two kinds of karma that ripen, except for the gods of the Pure Abodes.
The gods of the Pure Abodes are not reborn due to the ripening of karma, nor due to other karma.

In this way, the wind of karma always blows all sentient beings in the world, causing them to transmigrate. Bound by the snare of the mind, they are also bound by the snare of various karmas. With innumerable hundreds of thousands of different mental understandings and innumerable distinctions, they continue in sequence, always transmigrating through the five realms.
At that time, the newly born celestial being observes in this way and thinks in this way, and then he knows:
'I have fallen from such-and-such a realm and been reborn here.
I have fallen from the human realm and been reborn here due to the karma of rebirth.'
He knows this because of that karma. If he is reborn due to other karma, he also knows that.
For what reason does he know that this celestial being is not reborn due to other karma?
If it were due to other karma, the causes and conditions would be distant, and it could give rise to karmic retribution after a hundred kalpas;
there may be a thousand kalpas or a hundred thousand kalpas. One with little divine eye cannot see and know for oneself.
The causes and conditions of karma from a long time ago in past lives give rise to this rebirth. One born due to rebirth karma knows where they have come from.'

Having observed the causes and conditions of rebirth in this way, arrogance arises in his mind. Before long, due to the permeation of good karma, he gives rise to a mind of attachment to objects, with innumerable kinds.
The celestial being then thinks and knows in this way:
'I am now born in the Heaven of YÄma, in the place called Broad Practice Ground.'
As soon as he has this thought, celestial maidens appear before him.
Because of his good karma, the celestial maidens quickly come and surround him.
Due to the power of the celestial son's good karma, the celestial maidens come to him.

If the celestial maidens have been born there for a long time, they will not be shy. They will approach and embrace him, surround the celestial son, and enjoy various pleasures in the gardens and forests.
With the wages of good karma, he obtains celestial maidens with various qualities, the most delightful, and they enjoy pleasures together.

In that place there are beautiful mountain forests, lotus ponds, streams, and flowing water in valleys. There are beautiful flatlands, beautiful golden caves, and tree branch huts. There are countless hundreds of thousands of various birds with various sounds.
Countless hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens surround him, and in such places they sing and dance and play.
In the gardens there are deer made of the seven treasures roaming everywhere.
In this way, all that the eyes see is delightful.
There is a mountain called Broad Little, the peak of which has the radiance of the seven treasures, various adornments, and various precious stones interspersed.
There is a lotus flower forest, all of the seven treasures, in the garden grove. There are many rivers and ponds. In this way, the place is adorned with various things.
Due to good karma, with wonderful form and adornments, in such places, singing, dancing, playing, and enjoying various pleasures.
The gods, having thus enjoyed pleasures together, some play in the water.
In this way, various desires lead to hell, hungry ghosts, and animals.
Due to good karma, the play and enjoyment do not cease.
The gods themselves, in their bodies, show the names and characteristics of all heavenly karmic actions.
If the gods in their previous lives did what good karma?
With what mind did they perform the karma?
When did you do it?
What causes and conditions led you to do it?
Where were you born when you did it?
In this way, you did good deeds with the most excellent fields of merit and with the most excellent wealth.
All these details, your name, are seen on your own body.
It is just like a clear and skilled painter, who in each separate place, according to what he has done, is clearly visible.
Just like that name, this god is like this.
The painter of good karma, in the place of karmic action, paints all good karma everywhere.
The colors of good karma are very pure and bright, and when seen, they are extremely loved. He paints that god, who is delightful to see by all.
Just like the color painted by that skillful karma, it is born in this way.
That god's body, with such painted characters appearing, is a hundred times more majestic and excellent.
It is like the finest refined gold, or a red lotus treasure, or a blue-colored treasure. Among such various excellent treasures, the heavenly bodies are a hundred times more beautiful and lovely.
Such painted characteristics cannot be seen by one's own eyes.
Why is this?
Because they are located below the chin and above the throat, therefore they cannot be seen.
If the minds of those heavenly beings are not yet unrestrained, then they will see each other's characteristics;
Moreover, due to the causes of good karma, they will see each other's characteristics in this way.
The heavens in the place of vast practice are like this, rare.
Those heavens also have rare characteristics, like the characteristics of the throat, so too on the forehead.
Due to good karma, there are such characteristics.
Various karmic paintings have various colored characteristics.
What are called characteristics?
How does one regress?
At what time does one regress?
Having regressed in this way, where will one be reborn?
The various colors and patterns are all seen on the forehead of the gods.
This rare sign is created by karma.
On the bodies of the gods, there are such various garlands of letters, so beautiful.
Just like the various garlands of flowers that adorn the bodies and heads of the gods in other places, making them extremely wonderful, this sign of adornment is also like that.

Moreover, the gods have other good karmic fruits that have matured. Their own karmic paintings on their bodies, together with the various painted bodies of the goddesses, are beautifully adorned, and they experience various pleasures.
In the various gardens and forests, they play and enjoy themselves in the place of Broad Practice.ğŸ”½After enjoying themselves, they go to a river called Good Mixture.
The river flows out from the peak of the Mixed Love Mountain, so it is called Good Mixture.
The river is adorned with various jewels, and there are countless birds with various sounds. There are also countless different trees adorning the river.
There are various flowers with hundreds of thousands of different colors adorning the riverbanks. Countless celestial maidens play and enjoy themselves near the riverbanks.
There is also another marvelous river called the Mixed River.
This river flows out from the mountain peak of the variegated cliffs, hence it is called the Mixed River.
If the gods approach this river, they can remember their previous lives.
If they come to the riverbank from the hells, they will then remember.
Having remembered, they will have the most delightful five sense pleasures fully endowed, and the celestial maidens will be overjoyed and play and enjoy themselves.
Because they remember the suffering they have experienced, they forget all about pleasant things. In this way, they become disgusted with desire and speak this verse:
In the blazing fires of hell, the suffering is extremely great.
When our evil karma is exhausted, we all come to this place.
Good karma has good results, adorned with various merits;
Because evil karma is bad, the results are definitely experienced like this.
In the midst of suffering and pleasure, we revolve in the cycle of birth and death,
Blown by the wind of karma, just like waves in the ocean.
If one's mind does evil and delights in evil things,
Because of this unwholesome conduct, one falls into hell due to causes and conditions.
If one escapes from that hell and is reborn in the heavens,
Forgetting the suffering there, one again indulges in desires and pleasures.
In this realm of samsara, suffering and pleasure are like a measuring rope,
Yet their minds are very firm and tough, enduring suffering without weariness.
This shore and the other shore are united, deceived by the faculties,
Bound by the snare of craving, all flow and transmigrate through birth and death.
Emerging from hell, one is born as a ghost, emerging from ghost, one is born as an animal;
Emerging from other animals, one becomes a dragon, emerging from dragon, one is born in three places;
Karma like this always acts, the world turns like a wheel,
Because of long-term habituation, one still does not become weary.
Fond of the dragon palace, not fond of the suffering of hell,
Transmigrating in the prison of existence, with places of pleasure and displeasure.
A thousand pÄramitÄ sufferings, a hundred koá¹­Ä«s of pÄramitÄ,
Thus for such a time one endures suffering, foolishly not becoming weary.
The three realms are all without pleasure, universally filled with suffering,
Beings are deceived by delusion, yet do not become weary.
Having experienced such suffering, due to delusion one creates the causes of suffering.
Because of causes, there are effects, just as fruits come from seeds.
The mind is deluded by objects, with courage and great strength,
Beings tame that mind, causing it to be tranquil at that time.
When that mind has been subdued, it turns and moves through all realms,
Revolving in the three existences, unable to see the truth.
Just as the wind causes the waves of the ocean to move,
In the same way, the mind, which is the cause, always causes the world to revolve.
Beings are attached to women, grasped by suffering and pleasure,
They do not reach the good ground, the place of no suffering and distress.
If one remembers suffering at that time, then a mind of disgust arises,
Having forgotten that suffering and distress, one again becomes attached to pleasure and indulgence.
If there is anyone who can remember the suffering and distress of hell,
Such heavenly pleasures are like a tiny particle.
' The gods all remember their previous places of birth.
Those who are near the variegated river bank that emerges from the variegated cliff mountain peak all remember and know their previous places of birth;
Those who leave will forget all about their previous places of birth.
They have already forgotten the suffering in their minds, and forgotten their previous places of birth;

Having forgotten their previous births, they again enjoy and become attached to various objects, with countless kinds of heavenly wonderful objects that are not similar in appearance, such as delightful sounds, touches, tastes, forms, and smells, and thus experience such pleasures.
Having experienced such pleasures, they again go towards the mountain called Long Desire.
That Long Desire Mountain is universally delightful, with the foremost river and lotus ponds, its water pure and surrounding the mountain.
Swans, ducks, and mandarin ducks adorn the rivers and ponds, and the banks of the rivers are made of various gold and jewels, with the sounds of flowing water making various sounds.
In the mountains, there are ten thousand such rivers.
Various trees and various birds adorn them.
Among those rivers, the four rivers are the most excellent, namely:
The first is called Swift Flow;
The second is called Golden Garland;
The third is called Beryl Water;
The fourth is called Joyful Drifting.
These are called the four.

At that time, the heavenly beings, due to the ripening of their own karmic fruits, all gave rise to joyful minds like this, adorned their bodies with various garments, and, enjoying themselves and experiencing pleasure, went to the Swift Flow River.
Near the banks of that river, there is a long and wonderful flower tree forest called Immeasurable Joy.
When the flowers bloom, their branches densely cover the gaps, with immeasurable hundreds of thousands of various colored flowers.
There are flowing streams and ponds, with various kinds of birds, the bodies of the birds all made of various kinds of precious jewels, and the sounds of the birds filling everywhere.
On the second bank of the Swiftly Flowing River there is a lotus pond called Circumambulated by Drunken Bees.
Like the red lotus flowers that appear when the sun first rises, they adorn the pond, and such lotus flowers have the foremost fragrance, completely covering the pond water.
